qas.question: What type of steam engine doesn't need valves to direct steam?
What is another term for the pivot mounting?
Along with toys, where are oscillating cylinder steam engines typically used?
Full size working engines on what vehicles sometimes use oscillating cylinder steam engines?
What type of steam engine doesn't need valves to direct engines?
What is another term for the port face?
Where, along with toys, are oscillating cylinder port faces typically used?
On what vehicles do full size working engines sometimes use oscillating cylinder rocks?
What is a variant of the simple expansion pivot mounting?

context: An <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b4_0><b8_0>oscillating<a0_2/> cylinder<b4_0/><a0_1/><a0_0/> steam engine<b8_0/> is a variant of the simple expansion steam engine which does not require valves to direct steam into and out of the cylinder. Instead of valves, the entire cylinder rocks, or oscillates, such that one or more holes in the cylinder line up with holes in a fixed port face or in the pivot mounting (<a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b5_0>trunnion<b5_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>). These engines are mainly used in toys and <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b6_0>models<b6_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, because of their simplicity, but have also been used in full size working engines, mainly on <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>ships<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> where their compactness is valued.[citation needed]
